text: "Only Love" is a 1985 song by Greek singer Nana Mouskouri. It is the theme song to the American TV series Mistral's Daughter, based upon the novel by Judith Krantz. When released as a single, it reached number two on the UK Singles Chart in early 1986 and peaked atop the charts of Belgium, Ireland and the Netherlands. The song was also a hit in its other versions: "L'Amour en Héritage" (French), "Come un'eredità" (Italian), "La dicha del amor" (Spanish), and "Aber die Liebe bleibt" (German). The German version was also recorded with an alternate set of lyrics under the title "Der wilde Wein" but was withdrawn in favour of "Aber die Liebe bleibt". ==Charts== ===Weekly charts=== {|class="wikitable sortable plainrowheaders" style="text- align:center" !Chart (1985–1986) !Peak position |- |- |- !scope="row"|Europe (European Hot 100 Singles) |34 |- !scope="row"|Finland (Suomen virallinen lista) |4 |- |- |- |- |- |} ===Year- end charts=== {|class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center" !Chart (1985) !Position |- !scope="row"|Belgium (Ultratop) |8 |- !scope="row"|Netherlands (Single Top 100) |5 |} ==Sissel Kyrkjebø version== Norwegian soprano Sissel Kyrkjebø covered this song in Norwegian, titled "Kjærlighet" (Love), for her 1986 album Sissel and in Swedish for the Sweden- release of the album in 1987. ==References== Category:1985 singles Category:1985 songs Category:Dutch Top 40 number-one singles Category:Irish Singles Chart number-one singles Category:Nana Mouskouri songs Category:Number-one singles in Belgium Category:Single Top 100 number-one singles Category:Sissel Kyrkjebø songs Category:Songs with lyrics by Norman Gimbel
title: Only Love (Nana Mouskouri song)
